Administration.description: Displays server settings on the bot.
Sets bot client's username to a the single argument given.
A fake ban. You're not really banned. Jokes.

Bans a user. Only to be used in extrenuating circumstances. First argument given is the user. Second, if provided is the number of days for which to delete their messages. Anything else is given as the reason for the ban.
Adds a new shadowban criteria. Only to be used in extrenuating circumstances.

subcommands.description: Adds a specific user to the shadowban list.
Adds a new regex to ban new users upon arrival.
Adds a new regex to vet messages from new users.

Administration.description: Brings up a dialogue to removes shadowban criteria.
Use to evaluated javascript code. Bot owner only, for obvious reasons.
Use to call a given function inside a module.
Increases the semantic version count of the bot in package.json and in the nickname. Give argument `big` to increase Y count, `huge` to increase X count.
Decreases the semantic version count of the bot in package.json and in the nickname. Give argument `big` to decrease Y count, `huge` to decrease X count.
Sets the semantic version of LAZYbot to a custom specified value. Leave empty to return current value.
Backs up the database to a given file.
Restores the database from a given file.

subcommands.description: Builds a new embed in the specified channel

Builders.description: Creates a new builder by editing a previous message of LAZYbot's

subcommands.description: Edits a new embed in the specified channel

Builders.description: Sets the title of an active embed
Sets the description of an active embed
Sets the author of an active embed
Sets the thumbnail of an active embed
Sets the image of an active embed
Sets the footer of an active embed
Sets the content of an active embed
Sets the colour of an active embed
Sets the URL of an active embed
Adds a field to an active embed
Removes a field to an active embed
Locks an embed preventing further changes

Calculation.description: Takes betting odds in the form of US numbers and converts them to Decimal odds.
Takes betting odds in the form of decimal numbers and converts them to the American odds system.
Gets the reward currency for hosting a tournament. Requires three arguments of [games played in that tournament], [time control], [increment].
Begins process to generate a given type of odds. Please specify type requested.

subcommands.description: A fixed number of games between two players.
A set that ends when one player reaches a certain score (ex: first to 10).
A tournament for which there are no fixed 'rounds'.

Calculation.description:
Performs operation listed in the [Math object](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Math).
Please use format `operation(arguments)`, or it will not register.
Custom operations listed below.

Chess.description: Begins the process to use an OAuth2 grant to link the identity of a Discord profile with a Lichess profile
Adds a new puzzle to be presented formally to the channel and added to a temporary db of puzzles.
View currently active puzzles. Puzzles stay active for a maximum of 12 hours or until they are closed by the author.
Fetches an active puzzle by its index. If no arguments provided, displays all puzzles and awaits index input.
Posts the daily puzzle from lichess. **BETA**
Posts a random variant puzzle depending on the channel or arguments specified.
Closes an active puzzle by index. Only possible if you created the puzzle.
Posts the leaderboard for House Members of that variant on a given source. Based on linked accounts through the `${generic}lichess` and `${generic}chesscom` commands.
Renders a position from an fen string.
Links your Discord user profile to a lichess account.
Links your Discord user profile to a Chess.com account.
Links your Discord user profile to a bughousetest.com account.
Creates a dialogue that allows a user to pick an account linked to their discord account and unlink it.
Updates a user on all their accounts.
Gets the rank of a user across all leaderboards. Default is yourself.
Gets a leaderboard of results in a tournament on Lichess and filters them to players from the database
Gets a leaderboard of results for a shield tournament on Lichess and filters them to players from the database

Currency.description: Awards currency through the Nadeko bot. Bot owner only!
Takes currency through the Nadeko bot. Bot owner only!
Use to claim your 'timely' currency. Bot owner has to specify the amount and the period on how often you can claim your currency.

Gilds a given message, or if name provided, their last in the channel.
Costs 1 üå∏ to use.

Custom Reactions.description: List custom reactons for the server.
List emoji reactons for the server.
Addes add a new text custom reaction to react to keywords in new messages.
Edits an existing text custom reaction.
Toggles whether an existing text reaction is triggered from a keyword anywhere in the message.
Addes add a new emoji to react to messages containing keywords.
Edits an existing emoji custom reaction.
Toggles whether an existing emoji reaction is triggered from a keyword anywhere in the message.
Reacts to your message with all emoji listed in the message as separate words.

Reacts to a given message, or if name provided, their last in the channel, with all emoji listed in the message as separate words.
Can use animated emoji.
First argument must be message ID or user.

Election.description: Displays current election data. Use action to configure the election.

subcommands.description: Shows the status of an upcoming election on the server. Same as `!election`.
Readies a server for a new election, using default settings.
Changes the settings for an upcoming election, resetting any previous voting data and registered voters.
Sets election config data to the default.
Resets previous voting data.

Election.description: Performs an action on the voters register for an upcoming election on the server. Leave blank to display list of voters and elections.

subcommands.description: Registers voters ready for a new election. Resets previous voting data.
Deletes voting data. Leave blank to run function for all.
Removes a voter from all election records.
Gets the list of eligble voters for a channel. To be used in #spam only.

Election.description: Lists the ballots for which a user is eligible to vote. Defaults to self.
Displays the list of candidates for an upcoming election.

subcommands.description: Opens candidate registration. Done automatically when voter lists are registered.
Closes candidate registration.

aliases: I declare my intention to run as candidate for
subcommands.description: Registers a candidate. Give argument of channel that you wish to run for.
Readies a new declaration of sponsorship in a given channel. Give single argument of the channel name.

usage: I declare my intention to run as candidate for crazyhouse

Election.description: Sponsors a given candidate. Can only be used in the channel for which the election is taking place.

subcommands.description: Sends all ballots, initiates the voting stage of the election.
Sends one ballot to a specified user.
Sends mobile ballots to a specified user. `${generic}mobile` in DMs does the same thing.

Election.description: Collates valid votes received for an election.

subcommands.description: Closes voting on this server for all elections.
Reopens voting on a server for all elections.
Counts up the votes and saves the results, ready to be outputted.
Forcibly recounts the votes and overwrites the results, ready to be outputted.
Outputs the results of an election.

Election.description: Outputs the results of a recent election.
Display information about an Instant Run Off Election.

subcommands.description: Generates mock data for an IRV election.

ModMail.description: Sends a ModMail to a specified user. Use `-s` or `--server` flag to send as anonymous.

Help.description: Posts the bot's current ReadME file.
List the stable commands availabe on the bot.
Displays help info for a given command.

Profile.description: Generates a profile for the user summoned. Has customisable elements through the commands `${generic}finger` and `${generic}asl`. Supports linking to lichess, chess.com, and bughousetest.com accounts on second page.
Sets user age, sex, and location information. Requires three arguments. Use `-` to set null. Simply write `clear` to set all to null. Information appears on `${generic}profile`.
Returns number of messages for a given user. If none provided, defaults to self.
Edits the number of messages for a given user. If none provided, defaults to self.

Sets finger message. Can be viewed through `${generic}profile` or `${generic}finger`. Use `${generic}finger clear` to clear finger message. Otherwise just type `${generic}finger [your message here]` to set your message. Feel free to advertise your favourite things. Max limit of 500 characters

Sets your personal role colour to anything you want. Requires you to have bought the feature using `${nadeko}shop`. A colour is anything that fits [this criteria](https://discord.js.org/#/docs/main/stable/typedef/ColorResolvable).
Adds, edits, or removes a trophy for a user.

Trivia.description: Initiates new trivia game on Bouncer; begins process of registering rating on LAZYbot. Pokemon games are invalid.
Ends a trivia game on Bouncer.
Shows a list of trivia players who are currently being rated.
Adds a user who had previously excluded themselves from the trivia rating list.

Utility.description: Outputs data at a specified path on the 'this' tree, for debugging use
Registers a new 'team' in a server
Lists the 'teams' in a server, based on a pre-registry
Fetches a message from that channel from the id. Enable developer mode, then click on message options get its id. Have second argument of channel name if desired message is not in that channel.
Fetches the last message of a user. Defaults to self.
Returns the time elapsed since last bot restart. Note that host server glitch.com auto-restarts every 12 hours.

subcommands.description: Allows Bouncer individually to view the testing channels.
Blocks Bouncer individually from viewing the testing channels.

Utility.description: Toggles testing mode, which disables LAZYbot and Bouncer's permissions in the #spam and #devs channels. Specify 'true false' to just apply to one or the other.
Switches whether Nadeko or Bouncer has 'Bot-in-Use' role (full permission for server). To be used when Bouncer is offline, triggers automatically.
Alerts the players in the chanel to a new tournament you have created. Only accessible to Bronze++ members once every hour to prevent spam.

Displays a guide - a multipage information about something. There are guides for each variant! Compiled by the members of our community. Use `${nadeko}.. guides` to see info on how to contribute to them.
Posts a guide that has pages that can switch permanently. Use `${nadeko}.. guides` to see info on how to contribute to them.

Lists all guides. There are guides for each variant! Compiled by the members of our community. Use `${nadeko}.. GuideName` to view each one individually. Use `${nadeko}.. guides` to see info on how to contribute to them.
Fetches a message, but instead of outputting the same message, if the message has content, outputs the raw markdown required to produce that text. Developer's tool.
Fetches a message, but instead of outputting the same message, if and only if the message has an embed, outputs the raw JSON required to produce that embed. Developer's tool.
Returns the number of members in the database.

Returns the bot's ping in milliseconds.
**Note:** this is not your ping! This is the time taken for a client-emitted event to reach the bot, not how long it takes you to send a message.
Returns the data stored on a user
